title: Selena Gomez Opens Up About Lupus Diagnosis, Chemotherapy
text:
Selena Gomez Opens Up About Lupus Diagnosis, Chemotherapy By Michael Rothman Oct 8, 2015, 9:26 AM ET 0 Shares Star Mario Anzuoni/Reuters Singer Selena Gomez arrives at the 2015 MTV Video Music Awards in Los Angeles, Aug. 30, 2015. 0 Shares Email Selena Gomez took a break early last year from touring to handle her health. Now the 23-year-old singer is opening up about exactly what she was suffering from. “I was diagnosed with lupus , and I’ve been through chemotherapy. That’s what my break was really about. I could’ve had a stroke ," Gomez told Billboard for its latest cover story. Related: Selena Gomez Gives Intimate Details About Her Split From Justin Bieber According to the Mayo Clinic , lupus is "a chronic inflammatory disease that occurs when your body's immune system attacks your own tissues and organs." Organs affected by lupus include the kidneys , heart and lungs. The "Come & Get It" singer also responded to rumors her time off from the spotlight was for drug or alcohol addiction.
